DOC.brief_summary: Transurethral resection bladder ( TURB ) often perform outpatient procedure high-quality postoperative recovery particularly important . The aim study compare postoperative quality recovery spinal anesthesia ( SA ) general anesthesia ( GA ) transurethral resection bladder .
DOC.brief_title: Postoperative Quality Recovery After Transurethral Resection Bladder
DOC.detailed_description: After write informed consent obtain seventy patient age 18-80 year , ASA ( American Society Anesthesiologists ) physical status class I-III schedule TURB randomly assign either spinal anesthesia general anesthesia . Spinal anesthesia perform 12.5 mg bupivacaine mixed 25 mcg fentanyl . General anesthesia perform propofol fentanyl maintain sevoflurane , without use neuromuscular blocking agent . Quality Recovery 40 questionnaire ( QoR-40 ) administer 24 hour surgery use assessment postoperative recovery .
DOC.criteria: Transurethral resection bladder Age 18 80 year ASA IIII Contraindications spinal anesthesia Chronic pain use opioids last week Psychiatric disorder Allergy medication use study
